segment.source: Use pointer animations to provide users with visual feedback when the user taps on an item.
segment.target: Use pointer animations to provide users with visual feedback when the user taps on an item.

segment.source: The pointer down animation slightly shrinks and tilts the pressed item, and plays when an item is first tapped.
segment.target: The pointer down animation slightly shrinks and tilts the pressed item, and plays when an item is first tapped.

segment.source: The pointer up animation, which restores the item to its original position, is played when the user releases the pointer.
segment.target: The pointer up animation, which restores the item to its original position, is played when the user releases the pointer.

segment.source: When you use a pointer up animation, immediately trigger the animation when the user releases the pointer.
segment.target: When you use a pointer up animation, immediately trigger the animation when the user releases the pointer.

segment.source: This provides instant feedback to the user that their action has been recognized, even if the action triggered by the tap (such as navigating to a new page) is slower to respond.
segment.target: This provides instant feedback to the user that their action has been recognized, even if the action triggered by the tap (such as navigating to a new page) is slower to respond.
